JAMF reported robust C4Q net device adds implying sustained WFH tailwinds for Mac/iPad. JAMF (Covered by Sterling Auty) reported it is now managing over 20 mn devices at the end of 2020, implying 1.4 mn sequential device adds in C4Q vs. 1.4 mn net adds in C3Q, 0.9 mn net adds in C2Q, and 0.6 mn net adds in C1Q (see report here). The sequentially robust net device adds for JAMF could imply upside to Mac unit volume expectations for the December quarter, helped likely by strong commercial demand, with expectations for sequential volumes lowered on account of the Apple management team highlighting cycling past strong back-to-school related demand in the September quarter. JAMF is an Apple-focused device management company, which facilitates the management of Apple devices through zero touch deployment, lifecycle management, and security solutions for Mac and other iOS devices across both enterprise and education markets.

· App Store spending rose strong double-digit in C4Q and 2020; Momentum of Services continues to build. As per Sensor Tower’s publically available data, user spending on the App Store rose +30% y/y to $72.3 bn (gross proceeds) in 2020 from $55.5 bn in 2019, including growth of +25% y/y for gaming apps, which accounted for the largest portion of spending on the App Store at $47.6 bn, and +29% y/y for entertainment apps, which accounted for the second largest portion of spending on the App Store at $5.3 bn. Importantly, the full-year data implies user spending on the App Store rose +40% y/y to $20.5 bn in C4Q, highlighting an acceleration in growth from +31% y/y in C3Q, +29% y/y in C2Q and +26% y/y in C1Q and +35% y/y a year ago.

JAMF reported robust C4Q net device adds implying sustained WFH tailwinds for Mac/iPad. JAMF (Covered by Sterling Auty) reported it is now managing over 20 mn devices at the end of 2020, implying 1.4 mn sequential device adds in C4Q vs. 1.4 mn net adds in C3Q, 0.9 mn net adds in C2Q, and 0.6 mn net adds in C1Q (see report here). The sequentially robust net device adds for JAMF could imply upside to Mac unit volume expectations for the December quarter, helped likely by strong commercial demand, with expectations for sequential volumes lowered on account of the Apple management team highlighting cycling past strong back-to-school related demand in the September quarter. JAMF is an Apple-focused device management company, which facilitates the management of Apple devices through zero touch deployment, lifecycle management, and security solutions for Mac and other iOS devices across both enterprise and education markets.

· App Store spending rose strong double-digit in C4Q and 2020; Momentum of Services continues to build. As per Sensor Tower’s publically available data, user spending on the App Store rose +30% y/y to $72.3 bn (gross proceeds) in 2020 from $55.5 bn in 2019, including growth of +25% y/y for gaming apps, which accounted for the largest portion of spending on the App Store at $47.6 bn, and +29% y/y for entertainment apps, which accounted for the second largest portion of spending on the App Store at $5.3 bn. Importantly, the full-year data implies user spending on the App Store rose +40% y/y to $20.5 bn in C4Q, highlighting an acceleration in growth from +31% y/y in C3Q, +29% y/y in C2Q and +26% y/y in C1Q and +35% y/y a year ago.

JAMF reported robust C4Q net device adds implying sustained WFH tailwinds for Mac/iPad. JAMF (Covered by Sterling Auty) reported it is now managing over 20 mn devices at the end of 2020, implying 1.4 mn sequential device adds in C4Q vs. 1.4 mn net adds in C3Q, 0.9 mn net adds in C2Q, and 0.6 mn net adds in C1Q (see report here). The sequentially robust net device adds for JAMF could imply upside to Mac unit volume expectations for the December quarter, helped likely by strong commercial demand, with expectations for sequential volumes lowered on account of the Apple management team highlighting cycling past strong back-to-school related demand in the September quarter. JAMF is an Apple-focused device management company, which facilitates the management of Apple devices through zero touch deployment, lifecycle management, and security solutions for Mac and other iOS devices across both enterprise and education markets.

· App Store spending rose strong double-digit in C4Q and 2020; Momentum of Services continues to build. As per Sensor Tower’s publically available data, user spending on the App Store rose +30% y/y to $72.3 bn (gross proceeds) in 2020 from $55.5 bn in 2019, including growth of +25% y/y for gaming apps, which accounted for the largest portion of spending on the App Store at $47.6 bn, and +29% y/y for entertainment apps, which accounted for the second largest portion of spending on the App Store at $5.3 bn. Importantly, the full-year data implies user spending on the App Store rose +40% y/y to $20.5 bn in C4Q, highlighting an acceleration in growth from +31% y/y in C3Q, +29% y/y in C2Q and +26% y/y in C1Q and +35% y/y a year ago.
